pageContext.claim: “Very sad day & night in Paris. Maybe it’s time to end the ridiculous and extremely expensive Paris Agreement and return money back to the people in the form of lower taxes? The U.S. was way ahead of the curve on that and the only major country where emissions went down last year!”
pageContext.analysis: Emissions in the United States fell slightly between 2016 and 2017. But the rate of decline slowed under Trump and the month-to-month changes have been modest. Seven major countries, including the United States, are well behind achieving the pledges they made in Paris three years ago, a UN report concluded, with little time left to adopt much more ambitious policy measures to curb their emissions.
